abstract: Jonás Manuel Gutiérrez (locally: [xoˈnaz ɣuˈtjeres] (born 5 July 1983) is an Argentine footballer who plays for English club Norwich City on loan from Newcastle United, and for the Argentina national team, as a winger. He acquired his nickname "Spider-Man" or "Spider-Mag" (referencing Newcastle's nickname the Magpies) during his time at RCD Mallorca, where he celebrated a goal by putting on a Spider-Man mask. He also calls himself "el galgo", which means "the greyhound" in Spanish.He was considered a key part of the Argentine national side by former coach Diego Maradona, who stated that his team was "Mascherano, Messi, Jonás, and eight more." He appeared for Argentina in the 2010 World Cup.

He acquired his nickname "Spider-Man" or "Spider-Mag" (referencing Newcastle's nickname the Magpies) during his time at RCD Mallorca, where he celebrated a goal by putting on a Spider-Man mask.
